intro: Sphaerostephanos inconspicuus, commonly known as the inconspicuous starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
